title: What's the point of Corki?
body:
So Corkis niche is beeing an adc that deals a lot of magic damage...

With Kai'sa out there, why would you pick Corki over her? She does everything better especially dealing magic damage. 
His second strongest point probably is that he also is some kind of caster adc, but Kai'sas abilities also deal more damage than his.

At some point Varus stole that role as well, with TWO viable magic damage builds (on-hit/AP).

It's no longer his unique niche.

Back then, his massive advantage was to be able to deal magic damage while building AD items: the AD itemization has always been way over the AP one and back in the day magic damage was harder to prevent. Since he had best of both worlds, this resulted in him getting a really mediocre kit with unimpressive raw damage output by base.

Now that a single MR item is enought to prevent any kind of magic damage whatsoever today, Corki is left with his shitty base kit and is left over for Kaisa that actually has some HP% damage scalings
Corki is thel only viable adc/midlaner

Corki deals a significantly higher percentage of magic damage (over 90% magic damage) than Kai'sa and has better poke and escape than her as well, as well as a potent zoning tool. Kai'sa is more mixed damage (Closer to 50/50, all things considered), takes longer to scale and scales better, and is better at engaging and killing rather than at poking (Although her poke itself is fine, it's nowhere near as good as Corki's, but her all-in is magnitudes stronger).
